page.title: 02TONEDALE PAST
page.content:
This area gets its name from the{River {Tone},a small river,which flows through,and once provided water for the woollen mill.. Tonedale lies either side of the B3187 road to Milverton and is on the North West outskirts of Wellington. {LOCAL HISTORY. { }Tonedale was once taken up with the {Woollen Industry}(since 1772) and all its life was centred around the { {Mill.}The family who owned the mill, owned a great part of Wellington, and many streets were given their name.
The area had its own school and the main station for Wellington was along side of the Mill.Since the recent decline in the woollen industry,much of the factory is used for other enterprises and so is the school.The station is also closed.
